snippet: Raymond Roth, 47, was reported vanished while swimming off Long Island on Saturday, but was pulled over while speeding through South Carolina on Thursday, authorities say.
abstract: Police are investigating whether Raymond Roth, who was reported to have vanished while swimming at Jones Beach on Long Island, may have staged his death to escape his financial problems; New York State Park Police initiated an exhaustive but fruitless search for the missing swimmer; Roth was subsequently pulled over while speeding through South Carolina; charges have not yet been filed.

byline.contributor: Angela Macropoulos, Sheelagh McNeill and Eric P. Newcomer contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Raymond Roth, 47, was reported vanished while swimming off Long Island on Saturday, but was pulled over while speeding through South Carolina on Thursday, authorities say.

headline.seo: Raymond Roth, Missing Long Island Swimmer, Reported Alive in South Carolina
headline.main: As Missing Swimmer Is Found Alive, Case Takes a Turn
headline.print_headline: As Missing Swimmer Is Found Alive, Case Takes a Turn
